name: Fairfield Inn New York LaGuardia Airport/Flushing

reviews.text: Airport shuttle driver could not care less about our family. Was asleep before we arrived and seemed upset that we woke him up for a ride to LGA. Radio was loud, van was hot, phone was ringing, and he did nothing to remedy the situation until we asked. We had a sleeping child with us, and did nothing to help us.
reviews.title: OK room, bad service
loved it. Excellent hotel
reviews.text: Room was decent size and appeared clean. Saw a roach. Elevator was broke. 2 miles to LGA. In a bad neighborhood.
Very good shuttle to subway and airport. Excellent hot breakfast. Customer service was excellent. Very safe location.
reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised

likes.liked: — Superb service, room in very good condition
likes.disliked: — Internet access seems to be somewhat unreliable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for my first visit to New York. I must admit I was very nervous about the negative stereotypes of New York, and after my plane being delayed and the disgusting condition of La Guardia Airport, I was not in the best mood. But the shuttle driver for the hotel came and picked us up and he was extremely friendly and helpful. We got to the hotel and the front desk clerk was friendly and fast. The beds were amazing!! I don't think I've ever fallen asleep that fast in my life! The next day I needed to use the computer and the wired internet in my room wasn't working and neither was the internet in the lobby so they let me use the manager's computer in the back office. The shuttle driver then gave us a ride to the closest subway station and we went about our sightseeing. I was very happy with the service we received and pleasantly surprised with the room.
reviews.title: Had a nice mother's day weekend here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had some Marriott points, when kids from New York asked us to drive over for the mother's day weekend, we got a room at Flushing location at the last minute.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I'm writing this review from the Fairfield Inn, using the complimentary high speed access included in the room (and for once it's ACTUALLY high speed - unlike other places I've stayed). This is my third night and I only have good things to say about this place: the room was spotless when I arrived, the hotel staff is friendly and accommodating, and the entire hotel is smoke-free so there have been no musty odors to endure. It's also a fairly quiet neighbohood and, if you like to sleep in late, there are heavy curtains on the windows that'll keep the room nice and dark.
reviews.title: An Excellent Find...

reviews.text: The hotel is located in Flushing, but it's quite easy to get to Manhattan and other locations in the city. A free Fairfield shuttle van takes guests to within walking distance (about two short blocks) of the #7 train which runs all the way to Times Square in about 20-25 minutes (if you catch the Express...the Local takes a little longer) and then will pick them up when returning. Another plus is that the same shuttle will pick guests up at Laguardia, and then take them back for departure flights.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience Based on Great Reviews -- Thanks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As of 10/20/06 the AAA rate for a 220 sq. ft. room with a king sized bed, coffee maker, alarm clock, television, iron & ironing board, individually controlled heat & air conditioning, and a clean bathroom with a great shower - is about $150 a night. That may seem a little pricey, but I've paid much more for NY hotels that were nowhere near this nice.
reviews.title: A nice hotel convenient to the US Open

likes.liked: — friendliness of staff, location, cleanliness of room

reviews.text: I stayed here with my sister for two nights. My sister drove in over the Whitestone Bridge and it was very easy and convenient to get to. I flew into LaGuardia. The shuttle bus service was prompt and convenient. The room was very clean, and the bed was excellent. Very nice shower and bathroom as well. The major detraction for this hotel is the lack of any on-site or very nearby restaurants. However, the staff are very helpful in providing info for restaurants that will bring in food. We had an excellent salad, chicken wrap and pasta dish. The breakfast was good, including a waffle and hard-boiled eggs, along with yogurt, cereal, pastries and drinks.
reviews.title: Convenient and Clean

likes.disliked: — The lack of a restaurant on site or nearby.

reviews.text: The staff were pleasant and helpful. I would stay there again if I was in the area and needed a hotel.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: It's a Fairfield Inn, so you should know exactly what to expect, and this hotel provides it, only a little bit better. Not a lot of frills, but the property is new and spotless; the rooms are quiet and comfortable; the breakfast is more than adequate and, most importantly, the front desk man, Benjamin, is a real professional who is in Marriott's corporate training program and will obviously go far in the hospitality business. Little things get taken care of -- I commented in passing about a snowdrift blocking an emergency exit, and it was gone within minutes.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The real downside is that the location is wildly inconvenient if you don't have a car. There is really nothing within walking distance -- it's a sort of district of warehouses and other large facilities. Their shuttle van will take you to a nearby shopping district, or to the subway, or to the airports, though.
reviews.title: Quality All the Way

reviews.text: Note that there are two Fairfield Inns near Laguardia; this one has "Flushing" in its name and the other has "Astoria" in its name.
reviews.title: Friendly and convenient
